description: Remodelling to provide six residential units totalling 1,648 sqm.GIA (to replace the six existing residential units of 1,370sqm.); Construction of a new 2 storey coach house above a single level basement; Introduce new elements of built fabric which will be aligned to Passivhaus sustainability standards; Restoration of Arts and Crafts inspired garden (in lieu of the car parking previously proposed); Restoration of the ground floor dining room interior including a detailed facsimile of the Burne Jones Cupid & Psyche Frieze; Restoration of the mezzanine gallery above Lord Carlisle's painting studio; Removal of mid and late twentieth century interior features (such as the neo-classical plaster mouldings at second floor level and replacement by features sympathetic to the original interiors); Demolition and replacement of the modern south west extension, with the addition of a lower ground floor; Removal of the 1950s infill below the ground floor of the existing west extension to create lower ground floor residential accommodation and associated excavation of part of the west light well garden to provide daylight to the new accommodation; Extension of the common parts lobby at ground floor level to reflect more closely the entrance sequence of the original design; Improved security and safety through the provision of a ground floor concierge space and passive surveillance over the street and front entrance through fenestration which is more reflective of the original carriage drive portal that gave access to the original coach house and stables; Ground and lower ground floor duplex unit to include a new staircase located in Webb's original central ground floor staircase hallway but connecting to the lower ground, rather than the first floor; Low energy environmentally sustainable proposals for heating, cooling and ventilation along with improvements to the building fabric to enhance thermal performance, where appropriate.
